title: Gaboon viper
summary: The Gaboon viper (Bitis gabonica) is a viper species found in the rainforests and savannas of sub-Saharan Africa.[1] Like all vipers, it is venomous. It is the largest member of the genus Bitis,[2][3] and it has the longest fangs of any venomous snake – up to 2 inches  (5 cm) in length – and the highest venom yield of any snake.[3][4] No subspecies are recognized.[5]
